meanings.definition: One of four equal parts of something
meanings.sent1: I ate a quarter of the pizza.
meanings.sent2: She divided the cake into quarters.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel buried a quarter of its nuts in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His heart was broken into quarters after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The teacher cut the paper into quarters to share with the students.

meanings.definition: A period of three months, especially in relation to financial reporting
meanings.sent1: The company's earnings improved in the last quarter.
meanings.sent2: We are in the second quarter of the year.
meanings.sent3: The last quarter of the year always feels festive.
meanings.sent4: She worked hard to meet her sales target for the quarter.
meanings.sent5: The first quarter of the school year went by quickly.

meanings.sent1: I found a quarter under the couch.
meanings.sent2: He put a quarter in the vending machine for a snack.
meanings.sent3: The child was excited to get a shiny quarter from the tooth fairy.
meanings.sent4: She saved every quarter she earned in a piggy bank.
meanings.sent5: The parking meter only accepts quarters.

meanings.definition: To divide into four equal parts
meanings.sent1: Please quarter the apple before serving.
meanings.sent2: The chef showed us how to properly quarter a chicken.
meanings.sent3: He decided to quarter the sandwich to share with his friends.
meanings.sent4: The map helped us quarter the land for the new development.
meanings.sent5: She used a knife to quarter the watermelon for the picnic.

meanings.definition: To provide lodging or accommodations for someone
meanings.sent1: The innkeeper agreed to quarter the weary travelers for the night.
meanings.sent2: The military base will quarter the soldiers during training.
meanings.sent3: The kind family offered to quarter the stranded hikers in their guest room.
meanings.sent4: The hotel will quarter the conference attendees during the event.
meanings.sent5: The Airbnb host will quarter the guests in the cozy cottage.
